::Autofire::

The screech scrambled Autofire's circuits for a few short seconds,
several laser shots slamming into his frame. He was going to fast for
the other shots to hit. He growls, looking around the battle. The
Decepticons were seriously outnumbered.

Activating his comm to request assistance from Megatron, Autofire is
met with only static. He frowns, trying to contact any of the
Decepticons there and resulting in more static. Deactivating his comm,
Autofire angles up, firing two missiles at the Supernova/Scrap/Slasys jet.




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jen D." <jeniff@h...> wrote:
> (ooc: I'm not good at battles, so sorry if this is confusing :)
>
>
> Cyndro's scanners detected weaponfire outside the Element, and
quickly made
> a scan to find out who the attackers were. Soon he knew the location
and
> weaponry of every Decepticon in the area.
>
> "You might wanna go out there and fight them, Rubble, we're under
attack."
> he says through a speaker to Rubble, who thanks him and runs out of the
> base. Cyndro reroutes more power to the shields, and then activates the
> defences.
>
> The round plate on top of the Element flashed several times, and then a
> deafening screech was emmited over all comm frequencees other than
the ones
> that the Maximals were using. After a few seconds, the screech shut
off, and
> a jamming signal was sent out to disable any communications that the
enemies
> might have. During the screech, most of the weapons on the Element
fired at
> the hopefully distracted bots, sending four EMP blasts, one missile,
and
> five plasma shots at each one, other than the ones that were
shielded by the
> Cybertronian Fire (I think FireBlade is the only one shielded :).
>
>
> Mantle spun around when all the enemies arrived, and was immediately
ready
> for battle. He flew into the air and stretched out both arms. A
missile flew
> out of each arm, both of them mentally guided by Mantle to hit
> Rippersnapper. Out of the corner of his eyes, Mantle could see Aqua
firing
> his spear gun at Flesh Ripper, the same bot that he had tried to get
during
> the last battle. Near him, Cinder was already firing at Rippersnapper.
> Mantle knew that Cinder wanted to impress Prowl, but he hoped that she
> wouldn't do stupid things to show off.
>
> "Allright, guys, we'll fight like this for a while, and then we'll form
> Element and chase these guys out of here!" he said to his team over the
> commlink, watching Rubble emerge from the Element with his missile
launcher
> and fire two missiles at Rampage. Mist flew by above him, firing three
> charges down at Autofire.
